PlantVillage_Pepper__bell___Bacterial_sp: Remove infected plants. Spray with copper fungicides. Rotate crops.
PlantVillage_Potato___healthy: Plant is healthy. Maintain regular watering and monitoring.
PlantVillage_Tomato_Leaf_Mold: Improve air circulation. Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil. Avoid overhead watering.
PlantVillage_Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__: Control whiteflies with insecticides. Remove infected plants immediately. Use resistant varieties.
PlantVillage_Tomato_Bacterial_spot: Apply copper-based bactericides. Avoid working with wet plants. Remove infected debris.
PlantVillage_Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper. Rotate crops.
PlantVillage_Tomato_healthy: Plant is healthy. Continue good cultural practices.
PlantVillage_Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spo: Spray with water to dislodge mites. Use miticides or insecticidal soap. Introduce natural predators.
PlantVillage_Tomato_Early_blight: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil. Remove lower infected leaves. Mulch to prevent soil splash.
PlantVillage_Citrus: Inspect for specific citrus pests or diseases. Maintain proper nutrition and watering.
PlantVillage_Tomato__Target_Spot: Apply fungicides. Improve air flow. Remove infected plant debris.
PlantVillage_Pepper__bell___healthy: Plant is healthy. Maintain consistent watering and fertilization.
PlantVillage_Potato___Late_blight: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil. Destroy infected tubers. Plant resistant varieties.
PlantVillage_Tomato_Late_blight: Apply fungicides immediately. Remove and destroy infected plants. Avoid overhead irrigation.
PlantVillage_Potato___Early_blight: Apply fungicides. Maintain plant vigor with proper fertilization. Rotate crops.
PlantVillage_Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus: Remove infected plants. Wash hands and tools after handling. Control aphids.
test_set_images: Test image category. No prescription available.
no_cactus: Not a cactus. Verify plant type.
cactus: Cactus detected. Ensure well-draining soil and bright light.

Diseased_Leaf blotch: Apply fungicides. Remove affected leaves. Avoid wetting foliage.
Diseased_Bacterial infection: Apply copper-based sprays. Remove infected parts. Sterilize tools.
Diseased_Dieback: Prune affected branches well below the infection. Apply fungicide to cuts. Improve soil drainage.
Diseased_Irregular yellowing: Check for nutrient deficiencies or viral infections. Adjust fertilization or remove infected plants.
